title: NASA Mars Orbiter Spots Retired InSight Lander to Study Dust Movement
summary: New images taken from space show how dust on and around InSight is changing over time — information that can help scientists learn more about the Red Planet.

title: NASA’s Webb Finds Planet-Forming Disks Lived Longer in Early Universe
summary: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope just solved a conundrum by proving a controversial finding made with the agency’s Hubble Space Telescope more than 20 years ago. In 2003, Hubble provided evidence of a massive planet around a very old star, almost as old as the universe. Such stars possess only small amounts of heavier elements […]

title: Planet-forming discs lived longer in early Universe
summary: Our understanding of planet formation in the Universe’s early days is challenged by new data from the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope. Webb solved a puzzle by proving a controversial finding made with the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope more than 20 years ago.

title: NASA DAVINCI Mission’s Many ‘Firsts’ to Unlock Venus’ Hidden Secrets
summary: NASA’s DAVINCI probe will be first in 21st century to brave Venus’ atmosphere as it descends from above the planet down to its surface.

title: Europe signs contracts for IRIS² constellation
summary:
The European Commission and ESA signed contracts with an industrial consortium Dec. 16 to develop a secure connectivity constellation with a total cost of 10.6 billion euros ($11.1 billion).
